Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery cylindrical vessel, the fabric is partly grey in section, slight traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit on the interior, the exterior (large sections of the surface are now missing) is covered with a self-slip and remains of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393291) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393291)
